title: htmxr
text: htmxr est un package R qui fournit des primitives pour construire des applications web avec htmx et plumber2. Il est agnostique CSS — il ne dépend d’aucun framework CSS particulier.

title: htmxr
text: R avec conventions tidyverse plumber2 comme serveur HTTP (pas plumber v1) htmx pour les interactions client htmltools pour la génération HTML roxygen2 pour la documentation

what: Build Modern Web Applications with htmx and plumber2
title: Build Modern Web Applications with htmx and plumber2
text: Build modern web applications R — without writing JavaScript. htmx handles client-side interactions via HTML attributes. plumber2 handles R endpoints server-side. htmxr bridges two R helpers generate right HTML wire everything together.

title: Build Modern Web Applications with htmx and plumber2
Build Modern Web Applications with htmx and plumber2
text: first load, server returns complete HTML page. user interacts element (e.g. slider), htmx sends request R endpoint swaps response DOM — JavaScript needed, full page reload.

title: Build Modern Web Applications with htmx and plumber2
text: hello example ships htmxr. reproduces classic Old Faithful histogram slider control number bins.

title: Build Modern Web Applications with htmx and plumber2
text: GET / endpoint returns full HTML page built hx_page() hx_head(). slider created hx_slider_input(), generates <input type="range"> wired htmx attributes.
code: #* @get / #* @parser none #* @serializer html function() {   hx_page(     hx_head(title = "Old Faithful Geyser Data", bootstrap_css),     tags$div(       class = "container py-5",       # ...       hx_slider_input(         id = "bins",         label = "Number of bins:",         value = 30,         min = 1,         max = 50,         get = "/plot",         trigger = "input changed delay:300ms",         target = "#plot"       )       # ...     )   ) }

title: Build Modern Web Applications with htmx and plumber2
text: GET /plot endpoint standard plumber2 handler. receives bins query parameter, generates SVG histogram, returns HTML fragment.
code: generate_plot <- function(bins = 30) {   svg_string <- svglite::xmlSVG({     x <- faithful[, 2]     bins_seq <- seq(min(x), max(x), length.out = as.numeric(bins) + 1)     hist(x, breaks = bins_seq, col = "darkgray", border = "white")   })   svg_string }  #* @get /plot #* @query bins:integer(30) #* @parser none #* @serializer none function(query) {   generate_plot(query$bins) }

title: Detect if a request comes from htmx — htmxr_is_htmx
text: TRUE request made htmx, FALSE otherwise.

title: Detect if a request comes from htmx — htmxr_is_htmx
code: # Simulated htmx request req <- list(headers = list(`hx-request` = "true")) htmxr_is_htmx(req) #> [1] TRUE  # Regular request req <- list(headers = list()) htmxr_is_htmx(req) #> [1] FALSE
